text:
If a user's request includes a bad cookie sent up from the client side, the user
will not be able to see the page.  Instead, the request dies with an exception.
 See example from tomcat.log below, and note the bogus character in the cookie
name.  This cookie should be ignored, but the user should still be able to
receive his web page.  Corrupt cookie names like this could be due to bad files
on disk, bad packets, etc.

Seen in 3.2.2b2.
